newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: DUTCH DAF TRUCKS SCALES DOWN FULL-YEAR FORECAST.
newsitem.headline: DUTCH DAF TRUCKS SCALES DOWN FULL-YEAR FORECAST.

text.p: DAF Trucks NV said on Thursday it now expected turnover and profits for the full-year 1996 to remain steady.
"Given the hesitant character of west European sales, the DAF management board expects 1996 full-year turnover and profits to be at about the 1995 level," the company said in a statement.

DAF Trucks, the unlisted survivor of DAF NV which went bankrupt in 1993, previously said it expected higher turnover and profits in 1996. Last year its full-year net surged by 33.5 percent to 163.8 million guilders.
In the first half of the current financial year net profit rose 10.7 percent to 80.4 million guilders on 11.9 percent higher turnover of 1.47 billion.

The west European market for trucks heavier than 15 tonnes grew by 8.5 percent to 96.500 vehicles in the first half of 1996. DAF Trucks raised its share in this market to nine percent from 8.8 percent.
